Hello everyone,

Together with @María Inés de Frutos Fernández, I introduced the formalisation of a generalisation of MonoidAlgebra, SkewMonoidAlgebra on 2024-02-14T00:00:00+01:00 . We then updated this PR on 2024-04-15T00:00:00+02:00 to try and match the planned refactor by @Damiano Testa , see discussion here.

I wanted to ask here whether there are any news regarding a review? The shape of this work is important for upcoming work. In particular, we wish to define SkewPolynomial. We have ideas where to go from there but this is assuming no major change to the current version of SkewMonoidAlgebra. In other words: It would be nice to have a review before we continue.

Thanks a lot!
Xavier

I think that shielding the multiplication inside a structure is definitely good design!

For the analogous divide of (Add)MonoidAlgebra, I started thinking about refactoring AddMA and not MA, but the two are too entangled for that. I then started a merge of the two with a to_additive like tool for getting them to work in parallel, but that will probably take a long time to be reviewed.

The conclusion is that your PR should not depend implicitly or explicitly on the (Add)MonoidAlgebra refactor.
Thanks for your answer! Our PR should not depend on the MonoidAlgebra refactor; Xavier is just pointing that out because we want to make sure there is some consistency between the two definitions.

Hello everyone,

This PR is still in review and the following issue came up :

  • Should a MonoidAlgebra still have a coeFun instance? (see here)

For (p : MonoidAlgebra k G) and (a : G), this instance allows one to write p a to represent the value of p at a. This is what is currently done in MonoidAlgebra, but as there is a planned refactor that intends to separate MonoidAlgebra from Finsupp, and thus breaking the direct connection of MonoidAlgebra with it's corresponding finitely supported function, this will probably change?

In other words: Should we keep this or create a function akin to Polynomial.coeff?

The planned refactor of MonoidAlgebra is an ongoing project of @Damiano Testa but will take some time to happen (see above). I also wanted to ask the question publicly to have more opinions.

Thanks for your help!
Xavier
Thanks for the input! I have pushed a commit that adds a coeff function and removes the coeFun instance.
